channel.title: ICANN Domain Name Charge
channel.description: Does anybody know the rates, or where I can find them? (I only need to know .com and .co.uk)

item.title: ICANN Domain Name Charge
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:2, topic:312334"][quote author=inertia link=topic=408736.msg3017059#msg3017059 date=1257277032]
So if you’re a registrar you can register them for free? I thought there was a small charge per domain.
[/quote]Your question was how to register a domain name through ICANN, not how domain name registrars work.

Although you can read up on this to answer your question.[/quote]

No it wasn’t, I wanted to know the charges to registrars. I did find the answer to my question on that wikipedia article though, so thanks.

When a registrar registers a com domain name for an end-user, it must pay a maximum annual fee of US$6.86 to VeriSign, the registry operator for com, and a US$0.20 administration fee to ICANN.

Read full topic
